page.title: 03Lyminge Village Hall (cont)
page.content: Next to the hall is the Cub Hut which was opened shortly afterwards in July 1982 by Marion and Fred Hart. Every Tuesday the Cubs go from 6pm till 7.30pm. The Scouts hold their meetings on Fridays from 7.30pm until 9.15pm. The Cub Hut was bought from Dymchurch and constructed by the parents of the Cub Scouts. The Brownies and Guides both use the Hut on a Thursday. In 1982 we held a pageant on the green next to the village hall. It was all about life between Saxon times and the second world war. The whole school was involved and some of the villagers entered into the spirit by wearing costumes from the various periods. The Rector came as King Henry VIII and Mr Jones (our headmaster) came as a nineteenth century headmaster.
